cast.overview: Following the murder of her father by a hired hand, a 14-year-old farm girl sets out to capture the killer. To aid her, she hires the toughest U.S. Marshal she can find—a man with 'true grit'—Reuben J. 'Rooster' Cogburn.
cast.title: True Grit

cast.overview: Vignettes weaving together the stories of six individuals in the old West at the end of the Civil War. Following the tales of a sharp-shooting songster, a wannabe bank robber, two weary traveling performers, a lone gold prospector, a woman traveling the West to an uncertain future, and a motley crew of strangers undertaking a carriage ride.
cast.title: The Ballad of Buster Scruggs

cast.overview: Based on a true story, in which Richmond High School head basketball coach Ken Carter made headlines in 1999 for benching his undefeated team due to poor academic results.
cast.title: Coach Carter

details.biography:
From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia.  Paul Rae (born June 27, 1968) is an American film and television actor.

Rae was born Paul Rae Stuart in New Orleans, Louisiana, the son of Jean Rushing and Norman Stuart, and was raised in Bogalusa, Washington Parish, Louisiana.  He graduated from Bogalusa High School in 1986.  Description above from the Wikipedia article Paul Rae , licensed under CC-BY-SA,full list of contributors on Wikipedia.  ​
details.name: Paul Rae
